sen.j: 平 高棟（たいら の たかむね/高棟王（たかむねおう）、延暦23年（804年） - 貞観 9年5月19日 （867年6月24日））は平安時代前期の賜姓皇族。
sen.e: TAIRA no Takamune or Takamune o (Prince Takamune) (804 ~ June 24th, 867) was a shisei kozoku (member of the Imperial Family conferred with a family name) of the early Heian period who was given a surname TAIRA.

TAIRA no Takamune or Takamune o (Prince Takamune) (804 ~ June 24th, 867) was a shisei kozoku (member of the Imperial Family conferred with a family name) of the early Heian period who was given the surname TAIRA.
TAIRA no Takamune, or Prince Takamune, (804 - June 24, 867) was a shisei kozoku (member of the Imperial Family conferred with a family name) of the early Heian period who was given the surname TAIRA.
sen.cmt: Takamune o、()削除,補足~を-に訂正しました。

sen.j: 桓武平氏高棟流の祖。
sen.e: He is a founder of Kanmu Heishi (Taira clan) Takamune line.
He was the founder of Kanmu Heishi (Taira clan) Takamune line.
He was the founder of Kanmu Heishi (Taira clan) Takamune line.

sen.j: 祖父は桓武天皇、父は葛原親王、妻は藤原長良の女、藤原有子、子に平実範（平実雄とも言われる）、平正範、平惟範、平季長らがいる。
sen.e: His grandfather is Emperor Kanmu, father is the Imperial Prince Kazurahara, his wife is a daughter of FUJIWARA no Nagara, FUJIWARA no Ariko, and among his children are TAIRA no Sanenori (who is also called TAIRA no Saneo), TAIRA no Masanori, TAIRA no Korenori and TAIRA no Suenaga.

His grandfather is Emperor Kanmu, father was the Imperial Prince Kazurahara, his wifewas a daughter of FUJIWARA no Nagara, FUJIWARA no Ariko, and among his children were TAIRA no Sanenori (who was also called TAIRA no Saneo), TAIRA no Masanori, TAIRA no Korenori and TAIRA no Suenaga.

His grandfather is Emperor Kanmu, father was the Imperial Prince Kazurahara, his wife was a daughter of FUJIWARA no Nagara, FUJIWARA no Ariko, and among his children were TAIRA no Sanenori (who was also called TAIRA no Saneo), TAIRA no Masanori, TAIRA no Korenori and TAIRA no Suenaga.

sen.j: 平善棟、及び非実在説もある高見王らは弟。
sen.e: TAIRA no Yoshimune and Takami o (Prince Takami-there is an opinion that he never existed) are his younger brothers.
TAIRA no Yoshimune and Takami o (Prince Takami-there is an opinion that he never existed) were his younger brothers.
TAIRA no Yoshimune and Prince Takami, there is an opinion that he never existed, were his younger brothers.
sen.cmt: Takami o、()削除,補足スペース補足

sen.j: 天長2年（825年）7月6日に伯父に当たる淳和天皇から平姓を賜り、平高棟と名乗る。
sen.e: On July 6th, 825, he was given a surname TAIRA by his uncle, Emperor Junna, and called himself as TAIRA no Takamune.
On July 6, 825, he was given the surname TAIRA by his uncle, Emperor Junna, and he called himself TAIRA no Takamune.
On July 6, 825, he was given the surname TAIRA by his uncle, Emperor Junna, and he called himself TAIRA no Takamune.

sen.j: これが桓武平氏の起こりで、子孫は代々中流貴族として栄えた。
sen.e: This is the beginning of Kanmu Heishi (Taira clan), and its descendants were prosperous as the middle class noble men for generations.
This is the beginning of Kanmu Heishi (Taira clan), and its descendants were prosperous as the middle class noble men for generations.
This is the beginning of Kanmu-Heishi (Taira clan), and its descendants were prosperous as the middle class noble men for generations.

sen.j: 「平氏にあらずば人にあらず」
sen.e: "You are not a human if you do not belong to the Heishi clan."
"You are not human if you do not belong to the Heishi clan."
You are not human if you do not belong to the Taira clan.'
sen.cmt: 原文の「」にあわせて"を'に訂正。HeishiをTairaに訂正。

sen.j: と放言したと言われる平時忠は惟範の系統で10代目の子孫にあたり、源平合戦後も時国家として存続した。
sen.e: This wild remark was of TAIRA no Tokitada who is the line of TAIRA no Korenori and Tokitada is the 10th generation descendant and survived long as the Tokikuni family, even after the Genpei War (fight between Genji and Heishi clans.)

This wild remark was made by TAIRA no Tokitada who was in the bloodline of TAIRA no Korenori and Tokitada was the 10th generation descendant of the long surviving Tokikuni family, even after the Genpei War (fighting between the Genji and Heishi clans.)

This wild remark was made by TAIRA no Tokitada who was in the bloodline of TAIRA no Korenori and Tokitada was the 10th generation descendant of the long surviving Tokikuni family, even after the Genpei War (fighting between the Minamoto and Taira clans).
sen.cmt: 下の行を統合しました。原文訂正しました。the Genji and Heishi clansをthe Minamoto and Taira clansに訂正しました。

sen.j: また17代目の子孫にあたる西洞院行時は西洞院家を興し、西洞院家は堂上家に列したが戦国時代 に中絶し、河鰭家から西洞院時慶が養子が入って再興した。
sen.e: And the 17th descendant Yukitoki NISHINOTOIN founded the Nishinotoin family and belonged to the line of the Dojo families (the families who were permitted to enter in the palace), however, Nishinotoin family discontinued a while in the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States) and reconstructed later by inviting Tokiyoshi NISHINOTOIN from the Kawabata family as an adopted son.

And the 17th descendant Yukitoki NISHINOTOIN founded the Nishinotoin family and belonged to the line of the Dojo families (the families who were permitted to enter the palace), however, the Nishinotoin family discontinued a while during the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States) and was reconstructed later by inviting Tokiyoshi NISHINOTOIN from the Kawabata family as an adopted son.

And the 17th descendant Yukitoki NISHINOTOIN founded the Nishinotoin family and belonged to the line of the Dojo families (the families who were permitted to enter the palace), however, the Nishinotoin family discontinued a while during the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States) and was reconstructed later by inviting Tokiyoshi NISHINOTOIN from the Kawabata family as an adopted son.

sen.j: ※日付は旧暦。
sen.e: Dates are all of lunar calendar.
Dates are according to the lunar calendar.
Dates are according to the lunar calendar.

sen.j: 弘仁14年（823年）1月7日、従四位下に叙位。
sen.e: On January 7th, 823, he was ranked as Jushiige (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade.)
On January 7th, 823, he was ranked as Jushiige (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade.)
On February 25, 823, he was ranked as Jushiige (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).
sen.cmt: 旧暦は新暦にしました。th削除。

sen.j: 9月、侍従に任官。
sen.e: In September 823, he was posted to Jiju (Chamberlain).
In September 823, he was posted to Jiju (Chamberlain).
In September 823, he was posted to Jiju (Chamberlain).

sen.j: 天長元年（824年）9月22日、大学頭に転任。
sen.e: On September 22nd, 824, he was transferred to Daigaku-no-kami (Director of the Bureau of Education.)
On September 22nd, 824, he was transferred to Daigaku-no-kami (Director of the Bureau of Education.)
On October 21, 824, he was transferred to Daigaku no kami (Director of the Bureau of Education).
sen.cmt: 旧暦は新暦にしました。nd削除。大学頭、-削除

sen.j: 天長3年（826年）9月13日、中務大輔に転任。
sen.e: On September 13th, 826, he was transferred to Nakatsukasa-taifu (Senior Asst. Minister of the Ministry of Central Affairs.)
On September 13th, 826, he was transferred to Nakatsukasa-taifu (Senior Asst. Minister of the Ministry of Central Affairs.)
On October 21, 826, he was transferred to Nakatsukasa no taifu (Senior Assistant Minister of the Ministry of Central Affairs).
sen.cmt: 旧暦は新暦にしました。th削除。中務大輔、-削除

sen.j: 天長5年（828年）閏3月9日、大舎人頭に遷任。
sen.e: On the leap month March 9th, 828, he was chosen as the Otonerinokami (Director of the Bureau of Royal Attendants).
On the leap month March 9th, 828, he was chosen as the Otonerinokami (Director of the Bureau of Royal Attendants).
On April 30, 828, he was chosen as the Otoneri no kami (Director of the Bureau of Royal Attendants).
sen.cmt: 旧暦は新暦にしました。th削除。スペース補足

sen.j: 天長7年（830年）1月7日、従四位上に昇叙。
sen.e: On January 7th, 830, he was promoted to Jushiijo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade).
On January 7th, 830, he was promoted to Jushiijo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade).
On February 7, 830, he was promoted to Jushiijo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade).
sen.cmt: 旧暦は新暦にしました。th削除。

sen.j: 大舎人頭如元。
sen.e: His post as an official Otonerinokami was as it was and unchanged.
His position as an official Otonerinokami remained unchanged.
His position as an official Otoneri no kami remained unchanged.

sen.j: 10月13日、大蔵卿に転任。
sen.e: On October 13th, 830, he was transferred to Okurakyo (Minister of the Ministry of the Treasury).
On October 13th, 830, he was transferred to Okurakyo (Minister of the Ministry of the Treasury).
On November 5, 830, he was transferred to Okurakyo (Minister of the Treasury).
sen.cmt: 旧暦は新暦にしました。th削除。大蔵卿訂正しました。

sen.j: 天長8年（831年）、刑部卿に遷任。
sen.e: In 831, he was transferred to Gyobukyo (Minister of the Ministry of Justice).
In 831, he was transferred to Gyobukyo (Minister of the Ministry of Justice).
In 831, he was transferred to Gyobukyo (Minister of Justice).
sen.cmt: 旧暦は新暦にしました。刑部卿訂正しました。

sen.j: 承和 9年（842年）1月7日、正四位下に昇叙。
sen.e: On January 7th, 842, he was promoted to Shoshiige (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).
On January 7th, 842, he was promoted to Shoshiige (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).
On February 24, 842, he was promoted to Shoshiige (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).
sen.cmt: 旧暦は新暦にしました。th削除。

sen.j: 刑部卿如元。
sen.e: His post as an official Gyobukyo was as it was and unchanged.
His position as an official Gyobukyo remained unchanged.
His position as an official Gyobukyo remained unchanged.

sen.j: 8月11日、大蔵卿に遷任。
sen.e: On August 11th, 842, he was transferred to Okurakyo.
On August 11th, 842, he was transferred to Okurakyo.
On September 22, 842, he was transferred to Okurakyo.
sen.cmt: 旧暦は新暦にしました。th削除。

sen.j: 承和10年（843年）4月14日、従三位に昇叙。
sen.e: On April 14th, 843, he was promoted to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank).
On April 14th, 843, he was promoted to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank).
On May 20, 843, he was promoted to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank).
sen.cmt: 旧暦は新暦にしました。th削除。

sen.j: 大蔵卿如元。
sen.e: His post as an official Okurakyo was as it was and unchanged.
His position as an official Okurakyo remained the same.
His position as an official Okurakyo remained the same.

sen.j: 仁寿元年（851年）12月25日、参議に補任。
sen.e: On December 25th, 851, he was added to Sangi (Royal Advisors).
On December 25th, 851, he was added to Sangi (Royal Advisors).
On January 23, 852, he was added to Sangi (Royal Advisors).
sen.cmt: 旧暦は新暦にしました。th削除。

sen.j: 大蔵卿兼任如元。
sen.e: His post as an official Okurakyo was as it was and unchanged.
His position as an official Okurakyo remained unchanged.
His position as an official Okurakyo remained unchanged.

sen.j: 斉衡元年（854年）8月28日、春宮（惟仁親王＝のちの清和天皇）大夫を兼任。
sen.e: On August 28th, 854, he added his job of Togunodaibu (Master of the Crown Prince's Quarters) of Imperial Prince Korehito (latter day Emperor Seiwa).
On August 28th, 854, he added his job of Togunodaibu (Master of the Crown Prince's Quarters) of Imperial Prince Korehito (latter day Emperor Seiwa).
On September 27, 854, he added his job of Togu no daibu (Master of the Crown Prince's Quarters) of Imperial Prince Korehito (latter day Emperor Seiwa).
sen.cmt: 旧暦は新暦にしました。th削除。春宮大夫、訂正しました。

sen.j: 大蔵卿兼任を止むか。
sen.e: He might have resigned the post of Okurakyo? (unconfirmed)
He might have resigned the post of Okurakyo? (unconfirmed)
He might have resigned the post of Okurakyo? (unconfirmed)

sen.j: 天安 2年（858年）9月14日、権中納言に転任。
sen.e: On September 14th, 858, he was transferred to Gon Chunagon (Provisional Middle Counselor).
On September 14th, 858, he was transferred to Gon Chunagon (Provisional Middle Counselor).
On October 28, 858, he was transferred to Gon Chunagon (Provisional Middle Counselor).
sen.cmt: 旧暦は新暦にしました。th削除。

sen.j: 11月7日、正三位に昇叙。
sen.e: On November 7th of the same year, he was promoted to Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank.)
On November 7th of the same year, he was promoted to Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank.)
On December 19 of the same year, he was promoted to Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank.)
sen.cmt: 旧暦は新暦にしました。th削除。

sen.j: 権中納言如元。
sen.e: His post as an official Gon Chunagon was as it was and unchanged.
His post as an official Gon Chunagon remained unchanged.
His post as an official Gon Chunagon remained unchanged.

sen.j: 貞観 元年（859年）12月21日、陸奥出羽按察使を兼任。
sen.e: On December 21st, 859, he added his post of Mutsu Dewa Azechi (Inspector of the provincial government in Mutsu and Dewa.)
On December 21st, 859, the post of Mutsu Dewa Azechi (Inspector of the provincial government in Mutsu and Dewa) was added to his responsibilities.
On January 21, 860, the post of Mutsu-Dewa Azechi (local inspector of Mutsu and Dewa Provinces) was added to his responsibilities.
sen.cmt: 旧暦は新暦にしました。st削除。陸奥出羽按察使、訂正しました。

sen.j: 貞観2年（860年）1月16日、中納言に転任。
sen.e: On January 16th, 860, he was transferred to Chunagon (Middle Counselor.)
On January 16th, 860, he was transferred to Chunagon (Middle Counselor.)
On February 15, 860, he was transferred to Chunagon (vice-councilor of state.)
sen.cmt: 旧暦は新暦にしました。th削除。 "Middle Counselor" -> "vice-councilor of state" に変更しました。

sen.j: 陸奥出羽按察使兼任如元。
sen.e: His post as the previous added official post of Mutsu Dewa Azechi was as it was and unchanged.
His previously added official post of Mutsu Dewa Azechi remained unchanged.
His previously added official post of Mutsu-Dewa Azechi remained unchanged.

sen.j: 貞観6年（864年）1月12日、大納言に転任。
sen.e: On January 12th, 864, he was transferred to Dainagon (Major Counselor.)
On January 12th, 864, he was promoted to Dainagon (Major Counselor.)
On February 26, 864, he was promoted to Dainagon (chief councilor of state.)
sen.cmt: 旧暦は新暦にしました。th削除。 "Major Counselor" -> "chief councilor of state" に変更しました。
